packs.description: Modules may come bundled with Compendium packs which include game content for various Document types. Compendium packs are defined as objects which have their own internal metadata structure.

name.description: The compendium pack name - this should be a unique lower-case string with no special characters.

label.description: The compendium pack label - this should be a human readable string label which is displayed in the Compendium sidebar in-game.

system.description: The system this pack is designed for. Actor, Item and Adventure packs must declare this field.

path.description: The path for each compendium pack should designate a database file with the .db extension. As a best practice, we recommend placing these database files within the packs subdirectory. You do not need to create these files yourself. If a system includes a compendium pack, the database file for that pack will be created automatically when the system is loaded, if it does not already exist.

type.description: Each compendium pack must designate a specific Document type that it contains.
